body:
We've been discussing the current issues we face with the front page being dominated by 1-2 guilds and nothing else is getting through.

This approach would limit N number of posts from a particular guild on the front page. For example, N posts from +watchredditdie, N posts from +technology, and so forth until reaching 25. If your frontpage has less than 25 posts, the limit would be increased to fill it up to 25 posts.

This would only affect the homepage (ruqqus.com) and not all (ruqqus.com/all). The second page you view would be unaffected as well.

This limit of posts would apply to all guilds equally.

This would be a temporary solution until other guilds have reached critical mass.

Questions? Comments? Concerns?
body_html:

This limit of posts would apply to all guilds equally.

This would be a temporary solution until other guilds have reached critical mass.

body:
It's like the electoral college. We have a few powerful guilds that dominate the site, leaving the others not represented at all.

post.body:
We've been discussing the current issues we face with the front page being dominated by 1-2 guilds and nothing else is getting through.

This approach would limit N number of posts from a particular guild on the front page. For example, N posts from +watchredditdie, N posts from +technology, and so forth until reaching 25. If your frontpage has less than 25 posts, the limit would be increased to fill it up to 25 posts.

This would only affect the homepage (ruqqus.com) and not all (ruqqus.com/all). The second page you view would be unaffected as well.

This limit of posts would apply to all guilds equally.

This would be a temporary solution until other guilds have reached critical mass.

Questions? Comments? Concerns?

body: I sort by new so I can see what other guilds are out there. Also it's nice to see that now there are so many new posts per hour you can feel this site growing. That being said I think if the site is to continue to grow variety is the spice of life. If hot is the default for a site visitor they'll have a very skewed idea of what this site is. I say try it for a set period of time, a week? A month? And redo this poll or reassess site growth and interaction.

post.body:
We've been discussing the current issues we face with the front page being dominated by 1-2 guilds and nothing else is getting through.

This approach would limit N number of posts from a particular guild on the front page. For example, N posts from +watchredditdie, N posts from +technology, and so forth until reaching 25. If your frontpage has less than 25 posts, the limit would be increased to fill it up to 25 posts.

This would only affect the homepage (ruqqus.com) and not all (ruqqus.com/all). The second page you view would be unaffected as well.

This limit of posts would apply to all guilds equally.

This would be a temporary solution until other guilds have reached critical mass.

Questions? Comments? Concerns?

body:
Already mentioned: toggle-able. 

For temporary features like this, please have a clear end date, or at least clear end criteria. Transparency is important. 

I agree there is a bit of a problem, and I need to learn how to use he site better to craft my own view better. My concern with this solution is as follows: 
    
    Reddit’s similar solution is the primary reason there are a dozen nearly identical Bernie Sanders subs, and scores of similar democrat party subs. Astro turfers discovered they needed to spam create subs, not just posts to dominate the front page. 

Reddit is bad, don’t be like reddit 😇.
body_html:
Already mentioned: toggle-able.

For temporary features like this, please have a clear end date, or at least clear end criteria. Transparency is important.

I agree there is a bit of a problem, and I need to learn how to use he site better to craft my own view better. My concern with this solution is as follows:


Reddit’s similar solution is the primary reason there are a dozen nearly identical Bernie Sanders subs, and scores of similar democrat party subs. Astro turfers discovered they needed to spam create subs, not just posts to dominate the front page.

Reddit is bad, don’t be like reddit 😇.

post.body:
We've been discussing the current issues we face with the front page being dominated by 1-2 guilds and nothing else is getting through.

This approach would limit N number of posts from a particular guild on the front page. For example, N posts from +watchredditdie, N posts from +technology, and so forth until reaching 25. If your frontpage has less than 25 posts, the limit would be increased to fill it up to 25 posts.

This would only affect the homepage (ruqqus.com) and not all (ruqqus.com/all). The second page you view would be unaffected as well.

This limit of posts would apply to all guilds equally.

This would be a temporary solution until other guilds have reached critical mass.

Questions? Comments? Concerns?

body:
I know this is a temporary change, but I think the question that needs to be answered first is: What is the purpose of the home page?
I've seen some decent suggestions in the comments, but it's hard to say what would work best because everyone appears to have a different opinion on what the home page is meant to be. Is it meant to showcase the best content on ruqqus or just the most popular? Is it there to demonstrate the basic functionality of the site as succinctly as possible? Or is it just copying reddit's system?

I think that's a question that should be addressed before any legitimate changes are made.
body_html:
I know this is a temporary change, but I think the question that needs to be answered first is: What is the purpose of the home page? Is it meant to showcase the best content on ruqqus or just the most popular? Is it there to demonstrate the basic functionality of the site as succinctly as possible? Or is it just copying reddit's system?

I think that's a question that should be addressed before any legitimate changes are made.

body:
I suppose it's a little out of context for this post and I guess I didn't explain very well but I imagined this scenario:
I join a guild I like and it shows up on My personal homepage along with the other guilds I'm in.  But that guild overwhelms the page because of excess participation.  It seems like it'd be a nice feature to have the option to limit my specific exposure to that sub.  Different scenario than outright blocking a sub that I don't want to see at all.

This approach would limit N number of posts from a particular guild on the front page. For example, N posts from +watchredditdie, N posts from +technology, and so forth until reaching 25. If your frontpage has less than 25 posts, the limit would be increased to fill it up to 25 posts.

This would only affect the homepage (ruqqus.com) and not all (ruqqus.com/all). The second page you view would be unaffected as well.

This limit of posts would apply to all guilds equally.

This would be a temporary solution until other guilds have reached critical mass.

Questions? Comments? Concerns?

body:
I think this is a great idea, short-term solution though. (I explain an idea I think is better in my comment) On reddit, if I was subscribed to a small reddit that got a few posts and a big reddit that got many posts, I would never see the posts from the smaller reddit. The only way I could view posts from the smaller reddit was by going to the subreddit directly. This would definently level out the playing field, and make the feed more diverse between the different guilds.

Another way you can potentially tackle this problem is by amplifying the smaller guilds. Similar to a sort filter, it would effectively make it where, when filtered, the smaller guilds posts will appear first, followed by the larger guild posts. Like, keep it a good mix, but get the smaller guilds through first. 

For example, let's say guild A has 30 new posts, guild B has 20 new posts, and Guild C has 4 new posts. The filter would make it look like this:
(Guild) (first round)C,B,A,(second)C,B,A,(third)C,B,A,(fourth)C,B,A,(fifth)B,A,(sixth)B,A...etc..(26-30)AAAA....

body: I already voted and was one of the people talking in the discord about this, but I'm in favor of it as an interim method while the other possibilities put out there are considered or worked on.  It doesn't unfairly silence a guild from its earned popularity, there's still a place for it on the homepage, there's just a consideration for use of the commons that is the metapage.

parent.body:
I suppose it's a little out of context for this post and I guess I didn't explain very well but I imagined this scenario:
I join a guild I like and it shows up on My personal homepage along with the other guilds I'm in.  But that guild overwhelms the page because of excess participation.  It seems like it'd be a nice feature to have the option to limit my specific exposure to that sub.  Different scenario than outright blocking a sub that I don't want to see at all.

parent.body:
I know this is a temporary change, but I think the question that needs to be answered first is: What is the purpose of the home page?
I've seen some decent suggestions in the comments, but it's hard to say what would work best because everyone appears to have a different opinion on what the home page is meant to be. Is it meant to showcase the best content on ruqqus or just the most popular? Is it there to demonstrate the basic functionality of the site as succinctly as possible? Or is it just copying reddit's system?

I think that's a question that should be addressed before any legitimate changes are made.

body:
Yes and should affect ruqqus "all" too.

When someone from reddit hears of ruqqus and they come here they seen front page dominated by "watch reddit die" posts. So ruqqus looks like just a subsection of WRD full of anti reddit people. 

People should instead see front page full of funny animal memes, science and technology posts, gaming, interesting videos, and everything else which makes websites enjoyable. 

If all people see is "reddit bad" and "x political party terrible" then they will see nothing entertaining and they will leave.

Edit to add.  ... And should not be temporary. This limit should be permanent. The ruqqus front page should always be a sample of what ruqqus has to offer from an assortment of guilds.

This approach would limit N number of posts from a particular guild on the front page. For example, N posts from +WatchRedditDie, N posts from +Technology, and so forth until reaching 25. If your frontpage has less than 25 posts, the limit would be increased to fill it up to 25 posts.

This would only affect the homepage (ruqqus.com) and not all (ruqqus.com/all). The second page you view would be unaffected as well.

This limit of posts would apply to all guilds equally.

This would be a temporary solution until other guilds have reached critical mass.

Questions? Comments? Concerns?
post.title: [poll] Should Ruqqus temporarily limit the # of posts per guild on the frontpage (both when you're logged out and in)

body:
Maybe consider setting a new feed called "Diverse". This takes the top *n* posts (using whatever criteria..newest, hot, trending, etc) from all the subs and presents them.

OR a "Diverse" toggle, which would put that same filter on whichever feed you're looking at.  Leave it as a permanent option. Then when people get tired of seeing WRD in the trending feed, they could flick that switch on and see more trending posts from other guilds.
body_html:
Maybe consider setting a new feed called "Diverse". This takes the top n posts (using whatever criteria..newest, hot, trending, etc) from all the subs and presents them.

OR a "Diverse" toggle, which would put that same filter on whichever feed you're looking at. Leave it as a permanent option. Then when people get tired of seeing WRD in the trending feed, they could flick that switch on and see more trending posts from other guilds.

body: I think that would be a good idea for the time being while Ruqqus grows. At the moment there are only a couple very popular guilds so it can be hard to find new things if you're just looking at the home page. But, will it be the case that if I see all N posts from +Technology for the day that new posts won't show up for them on the main page for the day? Or does it reset each time I load up the page?
body_html: I think that would be a good idea for the time being while Ruqqus grows. This approach would limit N number of posts from a particular guild on the front page. For example, N posts from +watchredditdie, N posts from +technology, and so forth until reaching 25. If your frontpage has less than 25 posts, the limit would be increased to fill it up to 25 posts.

This would only affect the homepage (ruqqus.com) and not all (ruqqus.com/all). The second page you view would be unaffected as well.

This limit of posts would apply to all guilds equally.

This would be a temporary solution until other guilds have reached critical mass.

Questions? Comments? Concerns?

body:
I voted yes. It's sensible in the short term, and my frontpage has a bit too much WRD content. I do like the guild but I want to see other stuff too.

Eventually the solution might become a problem, if it "forces" the front page to become too static, by not giving focus to the communities where the activity is happening. This is a possible future problem though, no need to tackle it now. (A user config could solve that. I can expand further on the idea if you guys want.)
body_html:
I voted yes. It's sensible in the short term, and my frontpage has a bit too much WRD content. I do like the guild but I want to see other stuff too.

Eventually the solution might become a problem, if it "forces" the front page to become too static, by not giving focus to the communities where the activity is happening. This is a possible future problem though, no need to tackle it now. (A user config could solve that. I can expand further on the idea if you guys want.)

post.body:
We've been discussing the current issues we face with the front page being dominated by 1-2 guilds and nothing else is getting through.

This approach would limit N number of posts from a particular guild on the front page. For example, N posts from +watchredditdie, N posts from +technology, and so forth until reaching 25. If your frontpage has less than 25 posts, the limit would be increased to fill it up to 25 posts.

This would only affect the homepage (ruqqus.com) and not all (ruqqus.com/all). The second page you view would be unaffected as well.

This limit of posts would apply to all guilds equally.

This would be a temporary solution until other guilds have reached critical mass.

Questions? Comments? Concerns?

post.body:
We've been discussing the current issues we face with the front page being dominated by 1-2 guilds and nothing else is getting through.

This approach would limit N number of posts from a particular guild on the front page. For example, N posts from +watchredditdie, N posts from +technology, and so forth until reaching 25. If your frontpage has less than 25 posts, the limit would be increased to fill it up to 25 posts.

This would only affect the homepage (ruqqus.com) and not all (ruqqus.com/all). The second page you view would be unaffected as well.

This limit of posts would apply to all guilds equally.

This would be a temporary solution until other guilds have reached critical mass.

Questions? Comments? Concerns?

True, but... How much do you want to see mods and admins start decidint what upvoted content is "appropriate."

I would be ok with a limit on how much upvoted content  cam be on the front page in the early days of the site.  BUT, WE MUST BE EXTREMELY CAREFUL!!!

body: I think it would be a great idea to have every 3rd post or so be the recent hot post from a completely random guild with a possible restriction to SFW guilds/posts.  That way, we always have the possibility of discovering something new rather than get stuck in a bubble.
